page.title: 19Schooldays in Coatham 1905
page.content: Mrs Tate came to Redcar in 1905 at the age of 7 and is still alive today. She lived in West Coatham, which is now a part of I.C.I works. She had to walk over the fields and marshes to get to school which took her 45 minutes. The school was Coatham School which is now a Youth Training Centre. There were no lunches provided at school so the pupils had to bring their own. They didn't bring drinks as there was a tap and an iron cup in the yard for the children. The school closed at lunchtime so the pupils went to the beach or playground. Some girls went to the teacher's house to sew sheets. This was thought of as an honour. Being a Church school there was an assembly at the start and finish of every day and grace was said at the end of morning and afternoon school.
